item.title: Identify Slow Code With Devel::Timer
item.description: Program speed is an important factor in programming. No one wants their program to execute more slowly. As a general purpose programming language, Perl is usually fast enough for most things, and when it isn’t, we have some great tools to help us make it faster. We can use the Benchmark module to compare code and Devel::NYTProf to produce detailed analyses of our programs. This article is about Devel::Timer, another module I like to use when I want to optimize an existing subroutine, and I’m not sure how long each statement within the subroutine takes to execute.
